bugs.title: CVE-2013-6497 ClamAV: -a segmentation fault when processing files

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2013-6497 ClamAV: -a segmentation fault when processing files

long_desc.thetext:
Kurt Seifried of Red Hat reports:

the jwplayer.js file causes ClamAV to seg fault when scanned with the -a (list
archived files).
This is now public: http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2014/q4/673

Created clamav tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1165526]

Created clamav tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1165527]
clamav-0.98.5-1.fc20 has been pushed to the Fedora 20 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
clamav-0.98.5-1.fc19 has been pushed to the Fedora 19 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
clamav-0.98.5-1.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
clamav-0.98.5-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
clamav-0.98.5-1.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
clamav-0.98.5-1.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

*** Bug 1165587 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

clamav-0.98.5-1.el7 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 7.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/clamav-0.98.5-1.el7

clamav-0.98.5-1.el6 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 6.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/clamav-0.98.5-1.el6

clamav-0.98.5-1.el5 has been submitted as an update for Fedora EPEL 5.
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/clamav-0.98.5-1.el5

You may want to consider applying patch http://ix.io/ffp (published by Shawn Webb (lattera) of the core clamav development team) or waiting a while until the dust settles. http://lurker.clamav.net/message/20141119.111329.e9922b51.en.html is related.

I specifically asked lattera what he recommends doing in this situation re packagers. He said applying the patch would be ideal.

0.98.6, which contains a fix for this problem and also some other late-breaking bug fixes, might be released "Monday of next week at the very latest".

I can not really see how the Fedora/EPEL packages would be really affected
for regular users (or am I overlooking something?).

Sorry, this may have been a false alarm. I based my comments on the experiences of one other rpm-based packager, who encountered problems when upgrading from 0.98.4 to 0.98.5. Specifically clamd failed during service restart, and clamd did not start at server bootup. Applying the patch helped him, so I figured it might also be needed for EPEL.

I did quite a lot of testing on CentOS6, but I was unable to reproduce that problem. If there is a problem, it might affect EPEL7 because it is packaged differently. There's a separate clamav-lib in EPEL7 (and Fedora), but not in EPEL5/6.

I'll do more testing in CentOS7 tomorrow, it's middle of the night in my timezone now.
Sleep is for the weak.. I ended up testing the EPEL7 version a bit as well, and it did survive "systemctl restart clamd@name" just fine. I guess that's good.

Package clamav-0.98.5-1.el5:
* should fix your issue,
* was pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 testing repository,
* should be available at your local mirror within two days.
Update it with:
# su -c 'yum update --enablerepo=epel-testing clamav-0.98.5-1.el5'
as soon as you are able to.
Please go to the following url:
https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2014-4166/clamav-0.98.5-1.el5
then log in and leave karma (feedback).

clamav-0.98.5-1.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: CVE-2014-9050 clamav: heap-based buffer overflow when scanning crypted PE files

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2014-9050 clamav: heap-based buffer overflow when scanning crypted PE files

long_desc.thetext:
A heap-based buffer overflow flaw was found in ClamAV when scanning Windows PE files that were crypted with y0da's Crypter. Scanning a malicious PE file could cause ClamAV to crash or, potentially, execute arbitrary code.

Upstream fix:

https://github.com/vrtadmin/clamav-devel/commit/fc3794a54d2affe5770c1f876484a871c783e91e

References:
http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2014/q4/752
https://bugzilla.clamav.net/show_bug.cgi?id=11155 (currently private)

Created clamav tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1167140]
Affects: epel-all [bug 1167141]
Which ClamAV release contains a fix? 0.98.5 already? Or 0.98.6?

Ah, http://seclists.org/oss-sec/2014/q4/752 answers it (0.98.5 contains a
fix), sorry for the noise.
clamav-0.98.5-1.fc19 has been pushed to the Fedora 19 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
clamav-0.98.5-1.el5 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 5 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
clamav-0.98.5-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

clamav-0.98.5-1.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

This update has been pushed to stable

notes:
ClamAV 0.98.5
=============


ClamAV 0.98.5 also includes these new features and bug fixes:

  * Support for the XDP file format and extracting, decoding, and scanning PDF files within XDP files. Addition of shared library support for LLVM versions 3.1 - 3.5 for the purpose of just-in-time(JIT) compilation of ClamAV bytecode signatures. Andreas Cadhalpun submitted the patch implementing this support.
  * Enhancements to the clambc command line utility to assist ClamAV bytecode signature authors by providing introspection into compiled bytecode programs.
  * Resolution of many of the warning messages from ClamAV compilation.
  * Improved detection of malicious PE files.
  * Security fix for ClamAV crash when using 'clamscan -a'. This issue was identified by Kurt Siefried of Red Hat. 
  * Security fix for ClamAV crash when scanning maliciously crafted yoda's crypter files. This issue, as well as several other bugs fixed in this release, were identified by Damien Millescamp of Oppida.
  * ClamAV 0.98.5 now works with OpenSSL in FIPS compliant mode. Thanks to Reinhard Max for supplying the patch.
  * Bug fixes and other feature enhancements.

Please see the ChangeLog file or GIT log for further details.
title: clamav-0.98.5-1.el7
